scenarioDescription:
The HD 155358 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 155358 is a star with 1.15 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.38 times its radius. It is located 142.27 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 10.7 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 155358 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 155358 system


HD 155358 b

HD 155358 b was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory, in 2007-08, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.63 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 155358 b is 314.820 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 155358 b is 13.800 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 155358 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 155358 c

HD 155358 c was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory, in 2007-08, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 155358 c is 260.760 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 155358 c is 13.900 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 155358 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 155358, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the McDonald Observatory.
name: HD 155358 - System With 2 Exoplanets
